gbvision.models package¶

Submodules¶

gbvision.models.basic_ops module¶

gbvision.models.contours module¶

class gbvision.models.contours.FilterContours(min_area: float)¶

Bases: gbvision.utils.pipeline.PipeLine

gbvision.models.denoising module¶

class gbvision.models.denoising.Dilate(ksize: Union[int, Tuple[int, int]], iterations=1)¶

Bases: gbvision.utils.pipeline.PipeLine

creates a pipeline that dilates the image by a kernel of ones used mainly for Erode & Dilate denoise filters

Parameters

  • ksize – the kernel size, either an integer (meaning an nxn kernel) or a tuple (nxm kernel)

  • iterations – optional, the amount of Dilate iterations to perform, default is 1 None! a large number of iterations will slow down the program

Returns

a pipeline that dilates the given frame

class gbvision.models.denoising.Erode(ksize: Union[int, Tuple[int, int]], iterations=1)¶

Bases: gbvision.utils.pipeline.PipeLine

creates a pipeline that erodes the image by a kernel of ones used mainly for Erode & Dilate denoise filters

Parameters

  • ksize – the kernel size, either an integer (meaning an nxn kernel) or a tuple (nxm kernel)

  • iterations – optional, the amount of Erode iterations to perform, default is 1 None! a large number of iterations will slow down the program

Returns

a pipeline that erodes the given frame

class gbvision.models.denoising.MedianBlur(ksize: int)¶

Bases: gbvision.utils.pipeline.PipeLine

creates a pipeline that blurs the given frame using the median blur method works very good for denoising purposes

Parameters

ksize – the size of the kernel used by the filter, must be an odd number

Returns

a pipeline that filters the image using the median blur method

gbvision.models.shapes module¶

gbvision.models.shapes.circle_collision(circ1: Tuple[Tuple[float, float], float], circ2: Tuple[Tuple[float, float], float]) → bool¶
gbvision.models.shapes.convex_shape_collision(shape1: numpy.ndarray, shape2: numpy.ndarray) → bool¶

detects collision between two convex shapes Note: if you are uncertain if a shape is convex, use convex_hull on it, it will make it convex

Parameters

  • shape1 – the first shape, as a contour

  • shape2 – the second shape, as a contour

Returns

gbvision.models.shapes.rect_collision(r1: Tuple[float, float, float, float], r2: Tuple[float, float, float, float]) → bool¶
